page.title: 03Oil Refining at Stanlow
page.content: Oil refining at Stanlow is carrid out by{Shell UK Ltd.}and {Burmah/Castrol {Ltd.} Associated with this industry are many other companies such as{Van {Leer Ltd. }who make oil drums and the {Associated Octel Co. Ltd., }who produce addatives for oil and petroleum products. Crude oil reaches the refinery site via a pipeline to a deepwater anchorage off Amlwch, Anglesey; or from the Tranmere Oil Terminal; or directly from small tanker ships using the Manchester Ship Canal. The finished product is carried from the refinery by railway or road tanker.
